data.text: I use Google Maps online to get an overview, to sketch the itinerary, to calculate distances, to search for specific stuff in urban areas (laundromats, banks, etc). When actually on the road, I use the downloaded maps on Mapsme since you don't need to be online, and it works even in airplane mode to show your position and it offers relatively lower but still very useful information (again, your position but also main streets, roads, especially in some countries the wooded areas and trails for finding wild/stealth camp spots, though Google Maps satellite view is good for that, too, but then you have to be online). I don't need "navigation" in the sense of a voice telling me when to turn left or right.

data.text: I use a bike computer, because I am concerned about damaging my phone if I fall (which is very possible, as I ride a fair bit of off-road).
